title: (x) EMD Serono / Merck Global logos - custom by Landor {Jan E}
content:
What is the font used in the [Serono logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080116161926/http:/www.emdserono.com/)?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [EMD Serono.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080116161926/http:/typophile.com/files/EMD%20Serono.jpg) | 18.98 KB |

 [‹ (x) "Grain edit" lovely retro slab serif - Farao {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080116161926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39972 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 70s looking curly ampersand - Cabernet {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080116161926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39973 "Go to next forum topic")
author: BlueEyedPeas

comments.content:
I think it’s got too much of round corners to be univers.

Just realized that it is also the logo of [Merck global](http://web.archive.org/web/20080116161926/http:/www.merck.de/).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080116161926im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/MERCK_5314.jpg)

Can’t be ruled out for that reason; in logos you typically customize letters quite a bit. But the K is all wrong, so it can’t be univers after all.

Btw EMD is part of Merck

Could it be a DIN rounded version?

[http://www.typophile.com/node/17377](http://web.archive.org/web/20080116161926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17377 "http://www.typophile.com/node/17377")
